Leaves: Vary depending on species, generally spear or lance-shaped.
Flowers: Exclusively male or female, in a group called a
FruitSeeds: Small, develop within capsules and only last for 10 days or so.
Habitat: Along permanent watercourses or in seasonally wet areas and gullies.
DistinguishingFeatures: Most species are hybrids and can't be confidently identified to species level.
Impacts: Use much more water than native species, alter water flow, cause erosion, restrict stock water access.
